property.name: config
property.value:
{
 "version":"2.0",
 "widths":[ 1200, 1200, 1200, 1200, 1200, 1200, 1200, 1200, 1200, 1200 ],
 "CHARTS":[
 { "type":101,"span":1,"deep":5,"column":0,"order":3,"color":"#010161","symbol":"activity_date","datafilter":" ","name":"Date" },
 { "type":102,"span":1,"deep":5,"column":0,"order":8,"color":"#010161","symbol":"Sport","datafilter":" ","name":"Sport" },
 { "type":102,"span":1,"deep":5,"column":0,"order":13,"color":"#010161","symbol":"Workout Code","datafilter":" ","name":"Workout Code" },
 { "type":102,"span":1,"deep":32,"column":0,"order":35,"color":"#010161","symbol":"Notes","datafilter":" ","name":"Notes" },
 { "type":104,"span":2,"deep":25,"column":0,"order":68,"color":"#010161","xsymbol":"elapsed_time","ysymbol":"average_power","zsymbol":"workout_time","datafilter":" ","name":"Intervals Average Power" },
 { "type":104,"span":2,"deep":24,"column":0,"order":70,"color":"#010161","xsymbol":"elapsed_time","ysymbol":"power_index","zsymbol":"workout_time","datafilter":" ","name":"Intervals Power Index" },
 { "type":112,"span":1,"deep":12,"column":1,"order":29,"color":"#010161","program":"{:sl:n:sl:n# column names, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use name() to get correct name for locale:sl:n# otherwise it won't translate to other languages:sl:nnames { :sl:n metricname(Duration,:sl:n Time_Moving,:sl:n Distance,:sl:n Work,:sl:n W'_Work,:sl:n Elevation_Gain);:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# column units, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use unit() function to get correct string:sl:n# for locale and metric:sl:/imperial:sl:nunits { :sl:n metricunit(Duration,:sl:n Time_Moving,:sl:n Distance,:sl:n Work,:sl:n W'_Work,:sl:n Elevation_Gain);:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# values to display as doubles or strings:sl:n# if using metrics always best to use asstring():sl:n# to convert correctly with dp, metric:sl:/imperial:sl:n# or specific formats eg. rowing pace xx:sl:/500m:sl:nvalues { :sl:n asstring(Duration,:sl:n Time_Moving,:sl:n Distance,:sl:n Work,:sl:n W'_Work,:sl:n Elevation_Gain); :sl:n} :sl:n:sl:n}:sl:n ","sortcolumn":-1,"sortorder":0,"datafilter":" ","name":"Totals" },
 { "type":112,"span":1,"deep":12,"column":1,"order":54,"color":"#010161","program":"{:sl:n:sl:n# column names, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use name() to get correct name for locale:sl:n# otherwise it won't translate to other languages:sl:nnames { :sl:n metricname(Athlete_Weight,:sl:n Average_Speed,:sl:n Average_Power,:sl:n Average_Heart_Rate,:sl:n Average_Cadence);:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# column units, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use unit() function to get correct string:sl:n# for locale and metric:sl:/imperial:sl:nunits { :sl:n metricunit(Athlete_Weight,:sl:n Average_Speed,:sl:n Average_Power,:sl:n Average_Heart_Rate,:sl:n Average_Cadence);:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# values to display as doubles or strings:sl:n# if using metrics always best to use asstring():sl:n# to convert correctly with dp, metric:sl:/imperial:sl:n# or specific formats eg. rowing pace xx:sl:/500m:sl:nvalues { :sl:n asstring(Athlete_Weight,:sl:n Average_Speed,:sl:n Average_Power,:sl:n Average_Heart_Rate,:sl:n Average_Cadence); :sl:n} :sl:n:sl:n}:sl:n ","sortcolumn":-1,"sortorder":0,"datafilter":" ","name":"Averages" },
 { "type":112,"span":1,"deep":11,"column":1,"order":55,"color":"#010161","program":"{:sl:n:sl:n# column names, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use name() to get correct name for locale:sl:n# otherwise it won't translate to other languages:sl:nnames { :sl:n metricname(Max_Speed,:sl:n Max_Power,:sl:n Max_Heartrate,:sl:n Max_Cadence,:sl:n Max_W'_Expended);:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# column units, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use unit() function to get correct string:sl:n# for locale and metric:sl:/imperial:sl:nunits { :sl:n metricunit(Max_Speed,:sl:n Max_Power,:sl:n Max_Heartrate,:sl:n Max_Cadence,:sl:n Max_W'_Expended);:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# values to display as doubles or strings:sl:n# if using metrics always best to use asstring():sl:n# to convert correctly with dp, metric:sl:/imperial:sl:n# or specific formats eg. rowing pace xx:sl:/500m:sl:nvalues { :sl:n asstring(Max_Speed,:sl:n Max_Power,:sl:n Max_Heartrate,:sl:n Max_Cadence,:sl:n Max_W'_Expended); :sl:n} :sl:n:sl:n}:sl:n ","sortcolumn":-1,"sortorder":0,"datafilter":" ","name":"Maximum" },
 { "type":112,"span":1,"deep":12,"column":1,"order":125,"color":"#010161","program":"{:sl:n:sl:n# column names, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use name() to get correct name for locale:sl:n# otherwise it won't translate to other languages:sl:nnames { :sl:n metricname(IsoPower,:sl:n BikeIntensity,:sl:n VI,:sl:n Efficiency_Factor,:sl:n Aerobic_Decoupling,:sl:n Power_Index);:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# column units, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use unit() function to get correct string:sl:n# for locale and metric:sl:/imperial:sl:nunits { :sl:n metricunit(IsoPower,:sl:n BikeIntensity,:sl:n VI,:sl:n Efficiency_Factor,:sl:n Aerobic_Decoupling,:sl:n Power_Index);:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# values to display as doubles or strings:sl:n# if using metrics always best to use asstring():sl:n# to convert correctly with dp, metric:sl:/imperial:sl:n# or specific formats eg. rowing pace xx:sl:/500m:sl:nvalues { :sl:n asstring(IsoPower,:sl:n BikeIntensity,:sl:n VI,:sl:n Efficiency_Factor,:sl:n Aerobic_Decoupling,:sl:n Power_Index);:sl:n} :sl:n:sl:n}:sl:n ","sortcolumn":-1,"sortorder":0,"datafilter":" ","name":"Metrics" },
 { "type":100,"span":1,"deep":7,"column":2,"order":201,"color":"#010161","datafilter":" ","name":"RPE" },
 { "type":113,"span":4,"deep":17,"column":2,"order":213,"settings":"{ "title": " ",
"description": "A description of the chart, mostly useful when the chart is uploaded to the cloud to let others know what this chart is useful for etc. ",
"type": 1,
"animate": false,
"intervalrefresh": false,
"legendpos": 2,
"stack": false,
"orientation": 2,
"bgcolor": "#010161", 
"scale": 2.5,
"SERIES": [
{ "name": "Power ", "group": " ", "xname": "Elapsed Time ", "yname": "watts ", "program": "{:sl:n finalise {:sl:n # we just fetch samples at end:sl:n xx <- samples(SECS);:sl:n yy <- samples(POWER);:sl:n }:sl:n:sl:n x { xx; }:sl:n y { yy; }:sl:n}:sl:n ", "line": 1, "symbol": 0, "size": 3, "color": "#010112", "opacity": 100, "legend": true, "opengl": true, "datalabels": false, "aggregate": 0, "fill": true},
{ "name": "W'balance ", "group": " ", "xname": "Elapsed Time ", "yname": "kJ ", "program": "{:sl:n finalise {:sl:n # we just fetch samples at end:sl:n xx <- samples(SECS);:sl:n yy <- samples(WBAL):sl:/1000;:sl:n:sl:n :sl:n }:sl:n:sl:n x { xx; }:sl:n y { yy; }:sl:n}:sl:n ", "line": 1, "symbol": 0, "size": 3, "color": "#010157", "opacity": 75, "legend": true, "opengl": true, "datalabels": false, "aggregate": 0, "fill": false} ]
,
"AXES": [
{ "name": "Elapsed Time ", "type": 2, "orientation": 1, "align": 1, "minx": 0, "maxx": 0, "miny": 0, "maxy": 0, "smooth": 7, "groupby": 0, "visible": true, "fixed": false, "log": false, "minorgrid": false, "majorgrid": true, "labelcolor": "#2684f6", "axiscolor": "#2684f6"},
{ "name": "watts ", "type": 0, "orientation": 2, "align": 1, "minx": 0, "maxx": 0, "miny": 0, "maxy": 1000, "smooth": 0, "groupby": 0, "visible": true, "fixed": false, "log": false, "minorgrid": false, "majorgrid": true, "labelcolor": "#010112", "axiscolor": "#010112"},
{ "name": "kJ ", "type": 0, "orientation": 2, "align": 1, "minx": 0, "maxx": 0, "miny": 0, "maxy": 18, "smooth": 0, "groupby": 0, "visible": true, "fixed": false, "log": false, "minorgrid": false, "majorgrid": true, "labelcolor": "#010157", "axiscolor": "#010157"} ]
} ","datafilter":" ","name":"Power and W'balance" },
 { "type":112,"span":2,"deep":12,"column":2,"order":214,"color":"#010161","program":"{:sl:n:sl:n# column names, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use metricname() to get correct name for locale:sl:n# otherwise it won't translate to other languages:sl:nnames { :sl:n c(:qu:Name:qu:,:qu:Description:qu:,:qu:Low:qu:,:qu:High:qu:,:qu:Time:qu:,:qu:%:qu:);:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# column units, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use metricunit() function to get correct string:sl:n# for locale and metric:sl:/imperial:sl:nunits {:sl:n:sl:n c(:qu::qu:,:sl:n :qu::qu:,:sl:n zones(power,units),:sl:n zones(power,units), :qu::qu:, :qu::qu:);:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# values to display as doubles or strings:sl:n# if using metrics always best to use asstring():sl:n# to convert correctly with dp, metric:sl:/imperial:sl:n# or specific formats eg. rowing pace xx:sl:/500m:sl:nvalues { :sl:n:sl:n c( zones(power,name),:sl:n zones(power,description),:sl:n zones(power,low),:sl:n zones(power,high),:sl:n zones(power,time),:sl:n zones(power,percent));:sl:n} :sl:n:sl:n}:sl:n ","sortcolumn":-1,"sortorder":0,"datafilter":" ","name":"Power Zones" },
 { "type":103,"span":1,"deep":11,"column":2,"order":1720,"color":"#010161","series":50,"polarized":0,"datafilter":" ","name":"Fatigue Zones" },
 { "type":112,"span":4,"deep":50,"column":2,"order":1760,"color":"#010161","program":"{:sl:n:sl:n# column names, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use metricname() to get correct name for locale:sl:n# otherwise it won't translate to other languages:sl:nnames { :sl:n metricname(type, name,:sl:n Average_Power,:sl:n Distance,:sl:n Duration,:sl:n Fatigue_Index,:sl:n Power_Index,:sl:n W'_Work,:sl:n Work);:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# column units, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use metricunit() function to get correct string:sl:n# for locale and metric:sl:/imperial:sl:nunits { :sl:n metricunit(type, name,:sl:n Average_Power,:sl:n Distance,:sl:n Duration,:sl:n Fatigue_Index,:sl:n Power_Index,:sl:n W'_Work,:sl:n Work);:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# values to display as doubles or strings:sl:n# if using metrics always best to use asstring():sl:n# to convert correctly with dp, metric:sl:/imperial:sl:n# or specific formats eg. rowing pace xx:sl:/500m:sl:nvalues { :sl:n c(intervalstrings(type),:sl:n intervalstrings(name),:sl:n intervalstrings(Average_Power),:sl:n intervalstrings(Distance),:sl:n intervalstrings(Duration),:sl:n intervalstrings(Fatigue_Index),:sl:n intervalstrings(Power_Index),:sl:n intervalstrings(W'_Work),:sl:n intervalstrings(Work));:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n}:sl:n ","sortcolumn":-1,"sortorder":0,"datafilter":" ","name":"Intervals" },
 { "type":107,"span":1,"deep":7,"column":3,"order":453,"color":"#010161","program":"{ round(config(weight)*10):sl:/10; } ","units":"kg","istime":0,"start":99.3,"stop":85,"datafilter":" ","name":"Weight" },
 { "type":112,"span":2,"deep":11,"column":3,"order":457,"color":"#010161","program":"{:sl:n:sl:n# column names, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use name() to get correct name for locale:sl:n# otherwise it won't translate to other languages:sl:nnames { :sl:n c(:qu:Name:qu:,:qu:Description:qu:,:qu:Low:qu:,:sl:n :qu:High:qu:, :qu:Time:qu:, :qu:%:qu:);:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# column units, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use unit() function to get correct string:sl:n# for locale and metric:sl:/imperial:sl:nunits {:sl:n:sl:n c(:qu::qu:,:sl:n :qu::qu:,:sl:n zones(fatigue,units),:sl:n zones(fatigue,units),:qu::qu:, :qu::qu:);:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# values to display as doubles or strings:sl:n# if using metrics always best to use asstring():sl:n# to convert correctly with dp, metric:sl:/imperial:sl:n# or specific formats eg. rowing pace xx:sl:/500m:sl:nvalues { :sl:n:sl:n c( zones(fatigue,name),:sl:n zones(fatigue,description),:sl:n zones(fatigue,low),:sl:n zones(fatigue,high),:sl:n zones(fatigue,time),:sl:n zones(fatigue,percent));:sl:n} :sl:n:sl:n}:sl:n ","sortcolumn":-1,"sortorder":0,"datafilter":" ","name":"Fatigue Zones" },
 { "type":107,"span":1,"deep":7,"column":4,"order":17,"color":"#010161","program":"{ cp<-config(cp);:sl:n tabove <- count(samples(POWER)[x>cp]);:sl:n round((tabove :sl:/ Duration) * 100.0);:sl:n} ","units":"%","istime":0,"start":0,"stop":100,"datafilter":" ","name":"Time above CP" },
 { "type":103,"span":1,"deep":12,"column":4,"order":18,"color":"#010161","series":10,"polarized":0,"datafilter":" ","name":"Power Zones" },
 { "type":107,"span":1,"deep":7,"column":5,"order":1487,"color":"#010161","program":"{:sl:n est <- round((estimate(cp3,cp) +:sl:n estimate(cp2,cp) +:sl:n estimate(ext,cp)):sl:/3);:sl:n} ","units":"watts","istime":0,"start":0,"stop":360,"datafilter":" ","name":"CP Estimate" },
 { "type":107,"span":1,"deep":9,"column":5,"order":1497,"color":"#010161","program":"{:sl:n est <- round((estimate(cp3,w') +:sl:n estimate(cp2,w') +:sl:n estimate(ext,w')):sl:/3000);:sl:n} ","units":"kJ","istime":0,"start":5,"stop":45,"datafilter":" ","name":"W' Estimate" },
 { "type":101,"span":1,"deep":7,"column":5,"order":1498,"color":"#010161","symbol":"coggan_tss","datafilter":" ","name":"TSS" },
 { "type":101,"span":1,"deep":6,"column":5,"order":1522,"color":"#010161","symbol":"coggan_np","datafilter":" ","name":"NP" }
 ]
}

property.name: script
property.value:
## Python script ## 01-02'24 ## name = 'Py image 07' (Images-2 <- Images) ## creator = fe ## ## Updates: ## 1) Title ## 2) Filename (mouseover image) ## 3) Margin ## 4) Handle spaces in filename ## ## Wip... ##..................... import numpy as np import plotly as ply import tempfile import pathlib import os def main(): temp_file = tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(mode="w+t", prefix="GC_", suffix=".html", delete=False) ## option : # columns clns = 3 # True/False media = False # folder images_folder = '/media/' ##..................... ath = GC.athlete() athn = ath['name'] am = GC.activityMetrics() amd = am['date'].strftime('%a %x') amt = am['time'] prefix = "file:///" + ath['home'] + images_folder if media: image = [prefix + file for file in os.listdir(prefix[8:])] animages_txt = '' else: # Get images dropped to the activity on feb 2024 builds or later prefix = "file:///" + ath['home'] + '/media/' # images=[prefix+img for img in GC.getTag('Images').replace(' ','').split()] repalceSpaces = [prefix + img for img in GC.getTag('Images').replace(' ', '°°°').split()] # Reset spaces images = [i.replace('°°°', ' ') for i in repalceSpaces] # Add images dropped to the Image field images += GC.getTag('Image').replace('"', '').replace(' ', '').split() # am['ImgNotes'] animages_txt = '' if len(images) % clns: addv = (int(len(images) / clns) * clns) + clns - len(images) for i in range(addv): images.append('') imgl = np.array(images).reshape(-1, clns) imgll = [] img_txt = [] y_txt = [] x_txt = [] for yi, rw in enumerate(imgl[::-1]): for xi, img in enumerate(rw): img_txt.append(img) x_txt.append(xi + 1) y_txt.append(yi + 1) temp = dict(source=img, xref='x', yref='y', x=xi + 1, y=yi + 1, sizex=0.95, sizey=0.95, xanchor='center', yanchor='middle', sizing='contain', ) imgll.append(temp) imgll_txt = dict( x=x_txt, y=y_txt, type='scatter', mode='markers', name='', text=[os.path.split(path)[1] for path in img_txt], hoverinfo='text', opacity=0, ) noimg = 'No images for this activity!' if not imgll else '' tys = 'Activity' if not am['Sport'] else am['Sport'] annoimg = dict( x=clns // 2 + 1, y=0.5, text=noimg, showarrow=False, font=dict(size=50, color='red'), xref='x', yref='y', xanchor='center', yanchor='top' ) ## animages = dict(x=0,y=0.0085,text=animages_txt,showarrow=False,font=dict(size=12,color='indigo'),bgcolor="lightgrey",xref='paper',yref='paper',align='left',bordercolor='lightgrey',borderwidth=6,) ## y=0.0085 title_txt = "Athlete: " + \n " {0} ".format(athn) + \n " {0}: ".format(tys) + \n " {0}
".format(amd) + \n "Images save location: {0} ".format( prefix[8:]) layout = dict( images=imgll, title=dict(text=title_txt, y=0.955, x=0.5, xanchor='center'), font=dict(family='Arial', size=11, color='orange'), hoverlabel=dict( bgcolor="black", font_color='white', font_size=18, font_family="arial" ), paper_bgcolor='rgb(30,30,30)', plot_bgcolor='white', xaxis=dict( range=[0, clns + 1], visible=False, domain=[0, 1], ), yaxis=dict( range=[0, int(len(images) / clns) + 1], visible=False, domain=[0.02, 0.998] # [0.05,0.998][0.05,1] ), margin=dict(l=20, r=20, t=70, b=0), # annotations=[animages, annoimg] annotations=[annoimg] ) fig = dict(data=imgll_txt, layout=layout) ply.offline.plot(fig, auto_open=False, filename=temp_file.name, validate=True, config=dict(displayModeBar=True, scrollZoom=True)) GC.webpage(pathlib.Path(temp_file.name).as_uri()) if __name__ == "__main__": main()

property.name: config
property.value:
{
 "version":"2.0",
 "widths":[ 1200, 1200, 1200, 1200, 1200, 1200, 1200, 1200, 1200, 1200 ],
 "CHARTS":[
 { "type":101,"span":1,"deep":6,"column":0,"order":13,"color":"#010161","symbol":"activity_date","datafilter":" ","name":"Date" },
 { "type":112,"span":1,"deep":12,"column":0,"order":69,"color":"#010161","program":"{:sl:n:sl:n# column names, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use name() to get correct name for locale:sl:n# otherwise it won't translate to other languages:sl:nnames { :sl:n metricname(:sl:n Duration,:sl:n Time_Recording,:sl:n Time_Moving,:sl:n Distance,:sl:n Work,:sl:n Calories,:sl:n Elevation_Gain:sl:n );:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# column units, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use unit() function to get correct string:sl:n# for locale and metric:sl:/imperial:sl:nunits { :sl:n metricunit(:sl:n Duration,:sl:n Time_Recording,:sl:n Time_Moving,:sl:n Distance,:sl:n Work,:sl:n Calories,:sl:n Elevation_Gain:sl:n );:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# values to display as doubles or strings:sl:n# if using metrics always best to use asstring():sl:n# to convert correctly with dp, metric:sl:/imperial:sl:n# or specific formats eg. rowing pace xx:sl:/500m:sl:nvalues { :sl:n asstring(:sl:n Duration,:sl:n Time_Recording,:sl:n Time_Moving,:sl:n Distance,:sl:n Work,:sl:n Calories,:sl:n Elevation_Gain:sl:n ); :sl:n} :sl:n:sl:n} ","sortcolumn":-1,"sortorder":0,"datafilter":" ","name":"Totals" },
 { "type":112,"span":2,"deep":12,"column":0,"order":127,"color":"#010161","program":"{:sl:n:sl:n# column names, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use metricname() to get correct name for locale:sl:n# otherwise it won't translate to other languages:sl:nnames {:sl:n:sl:n c(:sl:n :qu:Name:qu:,:sl:n :qu:Description:qu:,:sl:n :qu:Low:qu:,:sl:n :qu:High:qu:,:sl:n :qu:Time:qu:,:sl:n :qu::qu::sl:n );:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# column units, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use metricunit() function to get correct string:sl:n# for locale and metric:sl:/imperial:sl:nunits {:sl:n:sl:n c(:sl:n :qu::qu:,:sl:n :qu::qu:,:sl:n zones(pace,units),:sl:n zones(pace,units),:sl:n :qu::qu:,:sl:n :qu:%:qu::sl:n );:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# values to display as doubles or strings:sl:n# if using metrics always best to use asstring():sl:n# to convert correctly with dp, metric:sl:/imperial:sl:n# or specific formats eg. rowing pace xx:sl:/500m:sl:nvalues { :sl:n:sl:n c(:sl:n zones(pace,name),:sl:n zones(pace,description),:sl:n zones(pace,low),:sl:n zones(pace,high),:sl:n zones(pace,time),:sl:n zones(pace,percent):sl:n );:sl:n} :sl:n:sl:n} ","sortcolumn":-1,"sortorder":0,"datafilter":" ","name":"Pace Zones" },
 { "type":112,"span":2,"deep":11,"column":0,"order":208,"color":"#010161","program":"{:sl:n:sl:n# column names, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use metricname() to get correct name for locale:sl:n# otherwise it won't translate to other languages:sl:nnames {:sl:n:sl:n c(:sl:n :qu:Name:qu:,:sl:n :qu:Description:qu:,:sl:n :qu:Low:qu:,:sl:n :qu:High:qu:,:sl:n :qu:Time:qu:,:sl:n :qu::qu::sl:n );:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# column units, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use metricunit() function to get correct string:sl:n# for locale and metric:sl:/imperial:sl:nunits {:sl:n:sl:n c(:sl:n :qu::qu:,:sl:n :qu::qu:,:sl:n zones(hr,units),:sl:n zones(hr,units),:sl:n :qu::qu:,:sl:n :qu:%:qu::sl:n );:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# values to display as doubles or strings:sl:n# if using metrics always best to use asstring():sl:n# to convert correctly with dp, metric:sl:/imperial:sl:n# or specific formats eg. rowing pace xx:sl:/500m:sl:nvalues { :sl:n:sl:n c(:sl:n zones(hr,name),:sl:n zones(hr,description),:sl:n zones(hr,low),:sl:n zones(hr,high),:sl:n zones(hr,time),:sl:n zones(hr,percent):sl:n );:sl:n} :sl:n:sl:n} ","sortcolumn":0,"sortorder":0,"datafilter":" ","name":"Heartrate Zones" },
 { "type":112,"span":2,"deep":13,"column":0,"order":247,"color":"#010161","program":"{:sl:n:sl:n# column names, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use metricname() to get correct name for locale:sl:n# otherwise it won't translate to other languages:sl:nnames { :sl:n c(:qu:Name:qu:,:qu:Description:qu:,:qu:Low:qu:,:qu:High:qu:,:qu:Time:qu:,:qu:%:qu:);:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# column units, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use metricunit() function to get correct string:sl:n# for locale and metric:sl:/imperial:sl:nunits {:sl:n:sl:n c(:qu::qu:,:sl:n :qu::qu:,:sl:n zones(power,units),:sl:n zones(power,units), :qu::qu:, :qu::qu:);:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# values to display as doubles or strings:sl:n# if using metrics always best to use asstring():sl:n# to convert correctly with dp, metric:sl:/imperial:sl:n# or specific formats eg. rowing pace xx:sl:/500m:sl:nvalues { :sl:n:sl:n c( zones(power,name),:sl:n zones(power,description),:sl:n zones(power,low),:sl:n zones(power,high),:sl:n zones(power,time),:sl:n zones(power,percent));:sl:n} :sl:n:sl:n}:sl:n ","sortcolumn":-1,"sortorder":0,"datafilter":" ","name":"Power Zones" },
 { "type":112,"span":4,"deep":25,"column":1,"order":50,"color":"#010161","program":"{:sl:n:sl:n# column names, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use metricname() to get correct name for locale:sl:n# otherwise it won't translate to other languages:sl:nnames {:sl:n:sl:n metricname(:sl:n name,:sl:n Pace,:sl:n Average_Power,:sl:n Average_Heart_Rate,:sl:n Average_Running_Cadence,:sl:n Distance,:sl:n Duration,:sl:n Fatigue_Index,:sl:n 1_min_Peak_Hr,:sl:n Elevation_Gain:sl:n );:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# column units, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use metricunit() function to get correct string:sl:n# for locale and metric:sl:/imperial:sl:nunits {:sl:n:sl:n metricunit(:sl:n name,:sl:n Pace,:sl:n Average_Power,:sl:n Average_Heart_Rate,:sl:n Average_Running_Cadence,:sl:n Distance,:sl:n Duration,:sl:n Fatigue_Index,:sl:n 1_min_Peak_Hr,:sl:n Elevation_Gain:sl:n );:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# values to display as doubles or strings:sl:n# if using metrics always best to use asstring():sl:n# to convert correctly with dp, metric:sl:/imperial:sl:n# or specific formats eg. rowing pace xx:sl:/500m:sl:nvalues {:sl:n:sl:n c(:sl:n intervalstrings(name),:sl:n intervalstrings(Pace),:sl:n intervalstrings(Average_Power),:sl:n intervalstrings(Average_Heart_Rate),:sl:n intervalstrings(Average_Running_Cadence),:sl:n intervalstrings(Distance),:sl:n intervalstrings(Duration),:sl:n intervalstrings(Fatigue_Index),:sl:n intervalstrings(1_min_Peak_Hr),:sl:n intervalstrings(Elevation_Gain):sl:n );:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# interval names indicate which interval:sl:n# the row represents so we can select:sl:n# and hover over them:sl:ni {:sl:n intervalstrings(name);:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# heatmap values are from 0-1 so we use the:sl:n# normalize() function to calculate it for the metrics:sl:n# in question. When we use normalize(0,0,metric) we:sl:n# will always get no heat, you can edit the min:sl:n# max values to set the range to set the heat color:sl:nheat {:sl:n:sl:n c(:sl:n normalize(0, 0, intervals(name)),:sl:n 1-normalize(0, config(cv) ,intervals(Pace)),:sl:n normalize(0, config(cp) ,intervals(Average_Power)),:sl:n normalize(0, config(lthr) , intervals(Average_Heart_Rate)),:sl:n normalize(0, 0, intervals(Average_Running_Cadence)),:sl:n normalize(0, 0, intervals(Distance)),:sl:n normalize(0, 0, intervals(Duration)),:sl:n normalize(0, 0, intervals(Fatigue_Index)),:sl:n normalize(0, 0, intervals(1_min_Peak_Hr)),:sl:n normalize(0, 0, intervals(Elevation_Gain)):sl:n );:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n} ","sortcolumn":-1,"sortorder":0,"datafilter":" ","name":"Intervals Data" },
 { "type":102,"span":1,"deep":6,"column":1,"order":0,"color":"#010161","symbol":"Sport","datafilter":" ","name":"Sport" },
 { "type":112,"span":1,"deep":12,"column":1,"order":6,"color":"#010161","program":"{:sl:n:sl:n# column names, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use metricname() to get correct name for locale:sl:n# otherwise it won't translate to other languages:sl:nnames { :sl:n metricname(:sl:n Athlete_Weight,:sl:n Average_Power,:sl:n Pace,:sl:n Average_Heart_Rate,:sl:n Average_Core_Temperature,:sl:n Average_Running_Cadence,:sl:n Average_Temp:sl:n );:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# column units, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use metricunit() function to get correct string:sl:n# for locale and metric:sl:/imperial:sl:nunits { :sl:n metricunit(:sl:n Athlete_Weight,:sl:n Average_Power,:sl:n Pace,:sl:n Average_Heart_Rate,:sl:n Average_Core_Temperature,:sl:n Average_Running_Cadence,:sl:n Average_Temp:sl:n );:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# values to display as doubles or strings:sl:n# if using metrics always best to use asstring():sl:n# to convert correctly with dp, metric:sl:/imperial:sl:n# or specific formats eg. rowing pace xx:sl:/500m:sl:nvalues {:sl:n:sl:n avgTemp <- mean(samples(TEMPERATURE));:sl:n :sl:n if (avgTemp = -255) {:sl:n avgTemp <- c( :qu:none:qu: );:sl:n } else {:sl:n avgTemp <- round(avgTemp, 1);:sl:n }:sl:n :sl:n c(:sl:n asstring(:sl:n Athlete_Weight,:sl:n Average_Power,:sl:n Pace,:sl:n Average_Heart_Rate,:sl:n Average_Core_Temperature,:sl:n Average_Running_Cadence:sl:n ),:sl:n avgTemp:sl:n );:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n} ","sortcolumn":-1,"sortorder":0,"datafilter":" ","name":"Averages" },
 { "type":102,"span":1,"deep":6,"column":2,"order":219,"color":"#010161","symbol":"Workout Code","datafilter":" ","name":"Workout Code" },
 { "type":112,"span":1,"deep":12,"column":2,"order":239,"color":"#010161","program":"{:sl:n:sl:n# column names, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use name() to get correct name for locale:sl:n# otherwise it won't translate to other languages:sl:nnames {:sl:n c(:sl:n metricname(:sl:n Max_Power,:sl:n 10_sec_Peak_Pace, :sl:n Max_Heartrate,:sl:n Max_Core_Temperature,:sl:n Max_Running_Cadence,:sl:n 5_min_Peak_Pace,:sl:n Max_Temp:sl:n ):sl:n );:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# column units, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use unit() function to get correct string:sl:n# for locale and metric:sl:/imperial:sl:nunits { :sl:n metricunit(:sl:n Max_Power,:sl:n 10_sec_Peak_Pace, :sl:n Max_Heartrate,:sl:n Max_Core_Temperature,:sl:n Max_Running_Cadence,:sl:n 5_min_Peak_Pace,:sl:n Max_Temp:sl:n );:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# values to display as doubles or strings:sl:n# if using metrics always best to use asstring():sl:n# to convert correctly with dp, metric:sl:/imperial:sl:n# or specific formats eg. rowing pace xx:sl:/500m:sl:nvalues {:sl:n:sl:n maxTemp <- max(samples(TEMPERATURE));:sl:n :sl:n if (maxTemp = -255) {:sl:n maxTemp <- c( :qu:none:qu: );:sl:n } else {:sl:n maxTemp <- round(maxTemp, 1);:sl:n }:sl:n:sl:n c(:sl:n asstring( :sl:n Max_Power,:sl:n 10_sec_Peak_Pace, :sl:n Max_Heartrate,:sl:n Max_Core_Temperature,:sl:n Max_Running_Cadence,:sl:n 5_min_Peak_Pace:sl:n ),:sl:n maxTemp:sl:n );:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n} ","sortcolumn":-1,"sortorder":0,"datafilter":" ","name":"Maximum" },
 { "type":103,"span":1,"deep":12,"column":2,"order":1872,"color":"#010161","series":6,"polarized":0,"datafilter":" ","name":"Pace Zones" },
 { "type":103,"span":1,"deep":11,"column":2,"order":1902,"color":"#010161","series":3,"polarized":0,"datafilter":" ","name":"Heartrate Zones" },
 { "type":103,"span":1,"deep":13,"column":2,"order":1903,"color":"#010161","series":10,"polarized":0,"datafilter":" ","name":"Power Zones" },
 { "type":100,"span":1,"deep":6,"column":3,"order":516,"color":"#010161","datafilter":" ","name":"RPE" },
 { "type":112,"span":1,"deep":12,"column":3,"order":527,"color":"#010161","program":"{:sl:n:sl:n# column names, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use name() to get correct name for locale:sl:n# otherwise it won't translate to other languages:sl:nnames { :sl:n metricname(:sl:n Aerobic_Decoupling,:sl:n Efficiency_Factor,:sl:n Relative_Intensity,:sl:n IsoPower,:sl:n VDOT,:sl:n IWF,:sl:n xPace:sl:n );:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# column units, if using metrics then best:sl:n# to use unit() function to get correct string:sl:n# for locale and metric:sl:/imperial:sl:nunits { :sl:n metricunit(:sl:n Aerobic_Decoupling,:sl:n Efficiency_Factor,:sl:n Relative_Intensity,:sl:n IsoPower,:sl:n VDOT,:sl:n IWF,:sl:n xPace:sl:n );:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n# values to display as doubles or strings:sl:n# if using metrics always best to use asstring():sl:n# to convert correctly with dp, metric:sl:/imperial:sl:n# or specific formats eg. rowing pace xx:sl:/500m:sl:nvalues {:sl:n asstring(:sl:n Aerobic_Decoupling,:sl:n Efficiency_Factor,:sl:n Relative_Intensity,:sl:n IsoPower,:sl:n VDOT,:sl:n IWF,:sl:n xPace:sl:n );:sl:n}:sl:n:sl:n} ","sortcolumn":-1,"sortorder":0,"datafilter":" ","name":"Metrics" },
 { "type":105,"span":1,"deep":25,"column":4,"order":3,"color":"#010161","symbol":"govss","datafilter":" ","name":"" },
 { "type":101,"span":1,"deep":6,"column":4,"order":0,"color":"#010161","symbol":"triscore","datafilter":" ","name":"TriScore" },
 { "type":102,"span":1,"deep":12,"column":3,"order":528,"color":"#010161","symbol":"Notes","datafilter":" ","name":"Notes" },
 { "type":106,"span":2,"deep":25,"column":3,"order":529,"color":"#010161","datafilter":" ","name":"Route" },
 { "type":104,"span":1,"deep":25,"column":0,"order":442,"color":"#010161","xsymbol":"elapsed_time","ysymbol":"average_speed","zsymbol":"workout_time","datafilter":" ","name":"Intervals" }
 ]

property.name: userData
property.value: <userdata name="Strokes" units="SPL" color="#cccc00" zstring="">XDATA("SWIM", "STROKES", repeat)</userdata><userdata name="SWOLF" units="SWOLF" color="#ffaa7f" zstring="">XDATA("SWIM", "TYPE", repeat)>0 ? XDATA("SWIM", "DURATION", repeat)+XDATA("SWIM", "STROKES", repeat) : 0</userdata>

property.name: script
property.value:
## R (Daimon) -> Python (Fe)
##.....................................................
##.....................................................
##
## R script
## Chart: SS-SR
## Creator: Daimon
##
## For use with GoldenCheetah
## tested on GC.version() is "DEV-V3.5 1705"
##

## SS-SR
## Last Edited At: 2017-09-26 - Creator: Daimon
## This stroke rate chart is combined with the SwimSmooth preferde (optimal) zones for freestyle swimming.

## This chart displays the (combined lowess) strokerate on the x-axis versus the pace on the y-axis.

## The script expects Garmin values for the Strokestyle. (1=freestyle, 2=backstroke, 3=breaststroke, 4=butterfly)

## It takes into account a 3m push-off per length/lane.
## You can change this value in the script at "pushoff<-3 ## push-off compensation (m)"
## The type of stroke can be change in the script at "strokestyle<-1## 1=freestyle, 2=backstroke, 3=breaststroke, 4=butterfly" but the defined strokerate areas are SwimSmooth Freestyle zones!

## There are simulair R-chart scripts available in the repository - this script is my interpretation and uses the available swim metrics - it's a matter of preference which script to use.

## Since no default value is defined for Pool Length there is a prerequisite.
## (If Pool Length is not available no strokerate nor pace will be calculated)

## Prerequisite:
## check in the menu under Tools->Options select the Datafields tab
## for the presence/definition of the DataField "Pool Length" .

## if not: in the Menu under Tools->Options select the Datafields tab
## select "+" and edit the created row to " Workout", "Pool Length" ,"Double"

## In the legenda "custom" indicates a pool length not exactly 25m or 50m

## http://www.swimsmooth.com/strokerate.html

##.....................................................
##
## Python script
## Chart: Py_SS-SR_04
## Creator: Fe 
##
## GC.version() "V3.6-RC1" (Build id: 4010 2022/07/04)
##
## 08'2022
## Python Script 
##
## Python: 3.7.9 (Aug 17 2020)
## Plotly: 4.6.0 --> 5.2.1
## Test: GarminSwimExample_2015_11_05_18_45_42.fit
##
## Golden Cheetah: "V3.6-RC1" (Build id: 4010 2022/07/04)
## Activities
##
## Note: add marker symbol (25 circle, 50 square, custom diamond -> sb1) (trace_sm_lowess)
##
##.....................................................

## packages
#import pandas as pd
import plotly as ply
import plotly.express as px
import plotly.graph_objs as go
import numpy as np
import datetime
import tempfile
import pathlib

#......................................................

#"""
#This module implements the Lowess function for nonparametric regression.
#Functions:
#lowess Fit a smooth nonparametric regression curve to a scatterplot.
#For more information, see
#William S. Cleveland: "Robust locally weighted regression and smoothing
#scatterplots", Journal of the American Statistical Association, December 1979,
#volume 74, number 368, pp. 829-836.
#William S. Cleveland and Susan J. Devlin: "Locally weighted regression: An
#approach to regression analysis by local fitting", Journal of the American
#Statistical Association, September 1988, volume 83, number 403, pp. 596-610.
#"""
# Authors: Alexandre Gramfort <alexandre.gramfort@telecom-paristech.fr>
#
# License: BSD (3-clause)

#https://gist.github.com/agramfort/850437

#from scipy import linalg 
from numpy import linalg

def gramfort_lowess(x, y, f=2. / 3., iter=3):

 #"""lowess(x, y, f=2./3., iter=3) -> yest
 #Lowess smoother: Robust locally weighted regression.
 #The lowess function fits a nonparametric regression curve to a scatterplot.
 #The arrays x and y contain an equal number of elements; each pair
 #(x[i], y[i]) defines a data point in the scatterplot. The function returns
 #the estimated (smooth) values of y.
 #The smoothing span is given by f. A larger value for f will result in a
 #smoother curve. The number of robustifying iterations is given by iter. The
 #function will run faster with a smaller number of iterations.
 #"""

 n = len(x)
 #r = int(ceil(f * n)) #update fe
 r = int(np.ceil(f * n)) #update fe 
 h = [np.sort(np.abs(x - x[i]))[r] for i in range(n)]
 w = np.clip(np.abs((x[:, None] - x[None, :]) / h), 0.0, 1.0)
 w = (1 - w ** 3) ** 3
 yest = np.zeros(n)
 delta = np.ones(n)
 for iteration in range(iter):
 for i in range(n):
 weights = delta * w[:, i]
 b = np.array([np.sum(weights * y), np.sum(weights * y * x)])
 A = np.array([[np.sum(weights), np.sum(weights * x)],
 [np.sum(weights * x), np.sum(weights * x * x)]])
 beta = linalg.solve(A, b)
 yest[i] = beta[0] + beta[1] * x[i]

 residuals = y - yest
 s = np.median(np.abs(residuals))
 delta = np.clip(residuals / (6.0 * s), -1, 1)
 delta = (1 - delta ** 2) ** 2

 return yest


#......................................................

temp_file = tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(mode="w+t", prefix="GC_", suffix=".html", delete=False)

#......................................................
xtext="Pace/100m (min:sec)"
ytext="Stroke Rate/min (srm)"

pushoff=3 ## push-off compensation (m)
strokestyle=1 ## 1=freestyle, 2=backstroke, 3=breaststroke, 4=butterfly

## plot colors
regionlowfill='rgb(80,118,163)'
# regionlowborder<-"#5076a3"
regionhighfill='rgb(163,75,73)'
# regionhighborder<-"#a34b49"
plot_bgc='rgb(25,25,25)'
paper_bgc='rgb(20,20,20)'

sb_size_min=1
sb_size_max=70
sb_alpha=0.5

## plot symbols
pl25='circle'#21
pl50='square'#22
plx='diamond'#23

#plot limits
xmin=130
xmax=60
ymin=30
ymax=100

stroketext=["Freestyle", "Backstroke", "Breaststroke", "Butterfly"]
header=(str(stroketext[strokestyle-1])+" stroke rate chart")

## ticks
at=np.arange(xmin,xmax-10,-10)
at_ms=['%d:%02d'%(x/60,x%60) for x in at]

## region low
x_region1=at #[130 ,120 ,110 ,100 ,90 ,80 ,70 ,60]
region_low=[50.0,50.8,51.6,53.0,54.5,57.0,61.0,67.0] 

## region high
x_region2=[130 ,120 ,110 ,100 ,95.5,90 ,80 ,70 ,67]
region_high=[61.8,63.4,65.2,68.0,70.0,73.1,83.1,96.0,100.0]

#......................................................

## data 

swim_field=['SWIM_TYPE','SWIM_DURATION','SWIM_STROKES']

metrics=GC.activityMetrics(compare=True)

act_datetime=[[metrics[i][0][y] for y in['date','time']] for i in range(0,len(metrics))]

act_list=[GC.activity(activity=datetime.datetime.combine(act_datetime[i][0],act_datetime[i][1])) for i in range(0,len(act_datetime))]

#......................................................

trace=[]
layout=dict(paper_bgcolor=paper_bgc,plot_bgcolor=plot_bgc)

##
for i in range(0,len(act_list)):

 if "SWIM_TYPE" in act_list[i]:

 swim=[];pace=[];sr=[];pace_sr=[];pl=[];f=[];pl_x_unique=[]
 pl_y_unique=[];trace_sm_lowess=[];trace_pace_sr=[] 

 swim=np.array_split([np.array(list(act_list[i][y]))[np.array(list(act_list[i]['SWIM_TYPE']))==strokestyle] for y in swim_field],1)

 if "Pool_Length" in metrics[i][0]: 
 Pool_Length=int(metrics[i][0]['Pool_Length'])
 else:
 Pool_Length=0

 pointfill=metrics[i][1]

 if Pool_Length==25: sb1=pl25 #25 #circle
 elif Pool_Length==50: sb1=pl50 #50 #square 
 else: sb1=plx #custom #diamond

 pace=swim[0][1]*100/Pool_Length

 sr=(60*2*swim[0][2]/swim[0][1])/(1-pushoff/Pool_Length) 

 pace_sr=np.array([pace,sr])


 #........................................................

 # License: BSD (3-clause)
 pl=gramfort_lowess(pace, sr, f=2./3.) # return y
 # ......................
 
 pl_x_unique=np.unique(np.round(pace),return_index=True,return_counts=True) 
 pl_y_unique=np.round(pl[pl_x_unique[1]],2) 
 f=pl_x_unique[2]/max(pl_x_unique[2]) 

 #........................................................

 trace_sm_lowess=dict(
 x=pl_x_unique[0],y=pl_y_unique,
 mode='lines+markers', 
 name=metrics[i][0]['date'].strftime('%A %y-%m-%d'),#'sm_lowess '+str(i+1),
 marker=dict(size=(sb_size_min+(sb_size_max-sb_size_min)*f),opacity=0.4,size_max=70,symbol=sb1),
 line = dict(color=pointfill,width=1,opacity=1))
 trace.append(trace_sm_lowess)

#......................................................

##
if 'SWIM_TYPE' in act_list[0]: 

 trace_region_low=dict(x=x_region1,y=region_low,
 mode='lines',hoverinfo='skip',showlegend=False,
 fill='tozeroy',
 line = dict(color=regionlowfill,width=0.1,opacity=0.6))
 trace.append(trace_region_low)

 trace_region=dict(x=x_region2,y=region_high,
 mode='lines',hoverinfo='skip',showlegend=False,
 line = dict(color=regionhighfill,width=0.1,opacity=0.6))
 trace.append(trace_region)

 trace_region_high=dict(x=x_region2,y=[100*len(region_high)],
 mode='lines',hoverinfo='skip',showlegend=False, 
 fill='tonexty',
 line = dict(color=regionhighfill,width=0.1,opacity=0.6))
 trace.append(trace_region_high)

 minor_xaxis=dict(overinfo='skip',showlegend=False,xaxis='x2')
 trace.append(minor_xaxis)
 minor_yaxis=dict(overinfo='skip',showlegend=False,yaxis='y2')
 trace.append(minor_yaxis)

##
 text=[]
 text.append(dict(x=min(at)+(max(at)-min(at))/2,y=32,text='Low Stroke rate',font=dict(size=12,color='rgb(0,0,255)'),showarrow=False))
 text.append(dict(x=min(at)+(max(at)-min(at))/2,y=96.5,text='High Stroke rate',font=dict(size=12,color='rgb(255,0,0)'),showarrow=False))
 text.append(dict(x=min(at)+(max(at)-min(at))/2,y=99,text=u'◯'+' 25 '+u'⃞'+' 50 '+u'⃟'+' custom',font=dict(size=11,color='white'),showarrow=False))

##
 layout=dict(
 paper_bgcolor=paper_bgc,
 plot_bgcolor=plot_bgc,
 title=header,
 titlefont=dict(color='white',size=18),
 hovermode='x',
 margin=dict(pad=20), 
 xaxis=
(dict(range=[xmin,xmax],titlefont=dict(size=13,color='rgb(132,159,190)'),linewidth=1,ticks="outside",color='white', tickwidth=0.5,ticklen=8,title=xtext,tickfont=dict(size=12,color='rgb(132,159,190)'),tickvals=at,ticktext=at_ms,mirror=True)),
 yaxis = dict(range=[ymin,ymax],titlefont=dict(size=13,color='rgb(132,159,190) '),linewidth=1,ticks="outside",color='white',tickwidth=0.5,ticklen=8,title=ytext,tickfont=dict(size=12,color='rgb(132,159,190)'),mirror=True),
 xaxis2 = dict(range=[xmax,xmin],showgrid=False,ticks="outside",color='white',ticklen=4,tick0 = xmax, showticklabels=False,overlaying = 'x', dtick = 1),
 yaxis2 = dict(range=[ymax,ymin],showgrid=False,ticks="outside",color='white',ticklen=4,tick0 = xmax, showticklabels=False,overlaying = 'y', dtick = 1),
 annotations=text,legend=dict(font=dict(size=11,color='lightgreen'),orientation="h",y=-0.24,xanchor="left",x=-0.03,yanchor="bottom"))


#......................................................

##
fig=dict(data=trace,layout=layout)


ply.offline.plot(fig,auto_open = False, filename=temp_file.name, validate=False)

GC.webpage(pathlib.Path(temp_file.name).as_uri())
